intro: Tridens ambiguus, commonly known as the ambiguous toothplant, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and spikes of tubular, two-lipped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and wetlands. Its unique floral structure and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study. Tridens ambiguus is also notable for its ability to thrive in wet environments, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native regions.
